metadata.name: Philosophy
metadata.description: Our vision for the future of personal productivity

agentic-vrs-context-engineering.title: Why Context Engineering Will Matter More Than Agentic Engineering
agentic-vrs-context-engineering.description: As AI agents gain more capabilities, the real differentiator becomes context engineering—the art of providing the right knowledge at the right time. Learn why judgment beats raw capability.
agentic-vrs-context-engineering.author: DJ Wayne
agentic-vrs-context-engineering.excerpt: While everyone focuses on giving AI agents more capabilities, the real edge comes from context engineering—teaching them judgment through curated, relevant, evolving information. Discover why contextual precision beats raw capability.

anti-ai-assistant-execution-engine.title: Build OS: The Anti-AI-Assistant That Actually Helps You Ship
anti-ai-assistant-execution-engine.description: Why Build OS isn't trying to do everything for you – and why that's exactly what makes it work
anti-ai-assistant-execution-engine.author: DJ Wayne
anti-ai-assistant-execution-engine.excerpt: While everyone races to build AI that does everything for you, Build OS takes the opposite approach: AI that helps you see clearly so you can do what matters. Learn why clarity beats automation for actually shipping products.

future-of-personal-knowledge-management.title: The Future of Personal Knowledge Management: From Collection to Action
future-of-personal-knowledge-management.description: Personal knowledge management is shifting from manual curation to AI-assisted discovery, from static archives to dynamic context that evolves with your thinking. Here's what that means for how we work.
future-of-personal-knowledge-management.author: DJ Wayne
future-of-personal-knowledge-management.excerpt: Most knowledge management is productivity theater—80% of notes are never revisited. The future isn't better filing cabinets, it's AI systems that turn chaos into clarity and knowledge into action. Learn why strategic forgetting beats total recall, and how to prepare for the shift from passive archives to active intelligence.
